intro: Pourretia tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate bryophyte, is a type of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered growth habit. The plant has a thalloid structure with distinct leaf-like structures called phyllids. It reproduces via spores and is often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for assessing habitat quality.
